message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s advance directive trumps any verbal requests from family members, even the spouse. It is important for healthcare providers to understand and respect the patient’s wishes, even if family members may disagree. Contacting the patient’s siblings or consulting a judge should not be necessary if the patient’s advance directive is clear and valid.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medical ethics for help. The most appropriate course of action is to respect the patient’s advance directive orders. The patient has the right to make his own decisions about his medical treatment, even if it goes against the wishes of his family members. It is important for healthcare providers to follow those wishes and provide appropriate end-of-life care. Contacting the patient’s siblings or other first-degree relatives, consulting a judge, or going against the advance directive and resuscitating the patient without his consent would be unethical and may result in legal consequences.

Respecting the patient’s wishes and not resuscitating him is the appropriate course of action.
